content: I show you my stuff with DM Scotty hey crafters I want to show you this portal
I worked on and it's a stone portal and I wanted to have some lights running
around it so here's what it is it's got cork here I build it out a cork and
those pillars I use TP and a pillar mold but I got this these running lights
these purple running lights and I glued them all around in different spots on
the inside and we'll take a look at it here turn on the lights here or turn off
the lights and that a cool effect Wow so I glued the lights at varying points
on the inside it is basically a cutting bat from the dollar store covered with
hot glue and then painted like a purplish color like a metallic purple
and I just thought that really came out to cool look great at the table I loved
it this other piece here I did is really cool also
it's just foam blocks right from a kid's playset
it's got cork bottom it's got a skull that somebody sent me and some casts
that's really all there is to it right but I think that really looks great
and here's Roderick and he'll get going in and it's a giant slayer that's why

in the opening here and it closes up so yeah pretty cool right but this door has

is that cool and I'll show you that here in a second so here we go let's try out
the lights and look wow isn't that cool that is so neat so when the players
approach the door it lights up like that and it's just those fairy lights wound
up inside this door here now let's take a look
with the lights on you can still see the lights in the you know with the lights
on you can still see them when you turn it off it looks like just like a stone
door I love that effect I love that trick so let's look at the door a little
more closely I just did a cardboard back with a cardstock around the side and I
put the fairy lights inside and the bottom is just cork with two small
dowels kind of jutting out to hold it in place
right and the lights just wind up and go inside the door it's just cardstock and
cardboard for the back and the front is a cutting mat that I cover with hot glue
and you know painted and the back has is little too little nubbins there they're
just little foam no nubbins to hold the door in place and when you pop that on
they just you know it hides that and you can just put the wire through the back
there and then turn it on and I hope you guys really like these light-up things I
got going here I hope you like the crafts today if you did make sure you
subscribe also if you'd like to support the em Scottie
